meanings.definition: The quality of being believable or worthy of belief.
meanings.sent1: The believability of the story made it easy to trust.
meanings.sent2: Her explanation lacked believability, so no one believed her.
meanings.sent3: The believability of his excuse was so low, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The believability of his promises was as solid as a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The believability of the magic trick left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is capable of being believed or accepted as true.
meanings.sent1: The movie's believability was so high that it felt real.
meanings.sent2: The believability of the conspiracy theory was questioned by many.
meanings.sent3: The believability of his excuse was so low, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The believability of her smile could light up a room.
meanings.sent5: The believability of the ghost story sent shivers down their spines.
